intro: Aiouea pittieri, commonly known as the Hawaiian hau tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, glossy surface. Aiouea pittieri plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
